h3. Problem Definition
While other types of appointments (Birthday,Leave, Travel) in Team Calendars have mention the username in Dashboard gadget "Upcoming events" the type "Event" have only Name, Calendar and description. it cause  misunderstanding for some users because they are able to see the event owner in a calendar interface.
h3. Suggested Solution
It would be good to have the option to show the event owner "Upcoming events" or notify the end user someway trhough the user interface.

Hi,
I am not sure if this already exists, if so a quick explanation of how would be great.  What we are looking for is a simply form on another page with a form:
Start Date: 
End Date:
What:
Description:
That after filled out simply add a calendar event.
Or even just a link from another page the "Add event" button.
I think many people could use this functionality, I know our company could use this is many places.

Please implement new type of restriction. Restriction to Administer calendar. This setting would allow users to:

* Ability to rename calendar (currently have only creator, who is unknown to others)
* Ability to set description
* Ability to restrict
* Ability to manage event types (add, hide, remove)
* Ability to remove calendar

Due to implementation of Custom Event types (TEAMCAL-1643 - Great job BTW), anyone who can edit calendar can also manage event types. This can make big mess - users makes event type for any nonsense. They can also remove lot of events by removing of custom event type.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49162].
  {panel}

Problem Definition
In the Cloud Environment, the Default System Calendar properties are configured to a max of 200 events. It's only possible to change this value in Server environments.

Suggested Solution
Provide an option where Cloud Customers have the ability to increase the number of Events that can be viewed in a Calendar

Workaround
none
fields.summary: Allow Cloud Customers the Ability to Set Team Calendar System Properties
Ability to create an event sending an email to Team Calendars

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49157].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When adding a new event, if you search for users through the 'WHO' field, that don't have Confluence access , but do have access to JIRA Only, Team Calendars won't reach those users

h3. Suggested Solution
Make team calendar be able to search those users, even though they won't use calendar, some may need that for assigning people from JIRA to those events and get that registered.
fields.summary: Ability to add JIRA Only users to Confluence Team Calendar events.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49156].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Definition
Currently the only way to tie JIRA issues together with Team Calendars is to add specific JIRA event types (JIRA Issue Dates, JIRA Agile Sprints, JIRA Project Releases). In the event you simply want to be able to reference a JIRA link in a standard Team Calendar, these types just don't work. Currently you would have to login to JIRA, find the issue, copy the link, paste into the related page field for a Team Calendars event. However this just shows a link to click to take you to the issue in JIRA.

h4. Suggested Solution
Offer something similar to the JIRA Issues Macro, where if an application link is setup for JIRA there is a new field in issues to search the JIRA instance. For example, if I wanted to find TEST-10999 I could enter that into the field, it would pop down, I would click that and save the event.

Further, once the saved event is clicked on it will show the JIRA issue similarly to how the JIRA Issue Macro displays a single issue.
fields.summary: Add ability to add JIRA links to Calendar Events
Ability to auto-populate jira tickets in Team Calendars.
Add event request to be accepted/rejected by administrator
Dependent Events Chains and Templates
Some disabled events types are visible
Rendering issue in Event macro ?
Export in csv or xml
Ability to assign the values of horizontal and vertical axis in Week mode.
Customize event display by color associated with JQL query

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49143].
  {panel}

When embeding a calendar on a page, the enabling/disabling of the calendar itself and its components is linked to the ones on the 'My Calendars' Page.

I would prefers to use the My calendars to administer them, and embed on pages to display specific configuration of some of the calendars.

While administering (creating new ones for example) it is better to disable the other ones to controll the display => they are disabled on the pages too...

Similary, the events displayed on the dashboard should be configured separately.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49135].
  {panel}

When you create a calendar event in Confluence, It would be nice to have the option to create a default page linked to it at the same time. 
This page URL would display in the "Related page" field of the event.
Currently, this is a three step process:
1. create the event
2. create the page
3. link the page to the event
Ideally, this should be a one step process.

Thanks,
Uri

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49123].
  {panel}

*This has been cloned from JIRA AGILE to track suggestion  

I want the ability to forecast work as its planned. 

Currently only active sprints and display on calendars.
After the scope of the project is defined i would like the ability to see the project on the calendars. 

I could start all the sprints to make them appear. but when a sprint end all open issues are added to the backlog instead of a the next sprint  

Suggestions 
a) add the ability to configure dates against planned sprints (preferred)  or 
b) add the option move incomplete issues to the next sprint
fields.summary: Forecasting Sprints  (Team calendars)
Allow calendars to individually define the first day of the week (Sunday/Monday)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49120].
  {panel}

Default event types don't have a What field (and have non-compulsory Summary further down instead), whereas custom events do have the compulsory What field (towards the top and no Summary).

It's very confusing for users to have to create/edit calendar entries differently depending on the Event Type. We don't differentiate Event Types as custom or default internally - we just want the calendar to work the same way for everyone/everything.

The What/Summary fields show as the “description” in the calendar view so they are helpful.

We would just prefer not to have them as different fields for each event type - and not be compulsory.
fields.summary: Change "description" fields on Custom and Default Event Types so that they are the same.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49119].
  {panel}

Current, Users don't know why the event type drop down is disabled. This drop down is enabled when user uncheck "Edit this instance only" checkbox.

Expected:
We should provide some ways to let users know how to enable the event type drop down such as showing a tool tip when users hover on this drop down.

!Change event type - concurrent events.png!
fields.summary: Users don't know why the event type drop down is disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49118].
  {panel}

ical Calendar parsing is slow.

I saw that you are using ical4j version 1.0-rc3-atlassian-8.

I have an example ics file with ca. 300 VEVENTs. Parsing it takes ca. 7s on my laptop.
Parsing it with any ical4j version >= 1.0 takes 450-600ms.

I suggest you look at merging back (at least some of) the improvements in the ical4j mainline.

I realise your customisations may make that difficult. Please at least look at integrating this straightfoward 3-line change that avoids useless expensive Calendar creation: https://github.com/ical4j/ical4j/commit/b4215c3d3559afbfc1530e4121708e8c61f0d18e

In my tests that alone cut 2/3 off the parsing time of your ical4j version.
fields.summary: ical4j parsing perfomance
Ability to Configure Team Calendar Create Window Fields

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As of now, should user try to add an event in Team Calendars and include some users in that particular events, those users will only get notifications via email.

h3. Suggested Solution
To integrate Team Calendars plugin and Confluence Workbox plugin, so that the users will also get notifications on their Workbox on top of the email notifications.

Improve sharing of calendars by allowing share via email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49103].
  {panel}

Google Calendar has this feature.
I want to schedule a meeting and find a time where everybody is free. So I select all the people I want to attend and the calendar shows me when everybody's free.

For meetings, where lots of people with lots of other stuff on their schedules come together - which is just about every meeting as far as I am concerned - we are really missing this.

At the moment, I would have to export a bunch of calendars, overlay them and then look for free spaces. So we don't do that and just use a HUGE Doodle or talk 10 minutes as a group about the scheduling instead, both of which is annoying.

Of course it get a bit complicated regarding calendars I am not allowed to view. I think it would be best if there were an on/off switch for taking events not visible to the current user (who is creating the new event) into account.
fields.summary: "Find a Time" Option for Scheduling Meetings
Customize JIRA Events Display Information

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49100].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Users who attempt to open a Confluence Page displaying multiple Calendar Macros with many Calendars experience Local Browser crashes which indicate "high memory usage detected"

h3. Environment
* Confluence 6.0.0-OD-2015.50.1-0003 with Team Calendars 5.3.8-D20151021T015515  
* Browsers:
** Firefox 42
** Chrome 46

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence Page and embed multiple (3) a Calendar Macros which contain multiple Calendars (30+) (Calendars range from 1-10+ Event Types)

h3. Expected Results
Page loads and does not consume 2+ GB of Local Resources for displaying this page in the browser

h3. Actual Results
Browser throws an error indicating "high memory usage detected 2GB"
Server utilization is low and Confluence logs do not indicate an issue
 
h3. Notes
With 3 Calendar Macros with ~30 Calendars each, Browser Memory utilization ranges 1.5 GB - 3 GB in both Firefox and Chrome
Removing 2 of the 3 Macros does improve memory utilization to about 400 MB - 1 GB when loaded
Systems with greater resources may not experience this issue as a lower resourced machine

h3.Workaround
Reduce the number of Calendar Macros, Calendars, and Event Types displayed
fields.summary: Reduce Local Browser Memory Usage When Loading Large Calendars in Confluence
Abilityt to integrate TC with JIRA Portfolio
Custom Events do not show "Who" name when displaying on Dashboard

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Calculated custom fields from JIRA are not recognized by Team Calendars. The field is not retrieved when 

# Add a 'Calculated Date/Time Field' in JIRA that is part of the [JIRA Misc Custom Fields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmcf.jira-misc-custom-fields] add-on.

# Add the field to a project

h3. Suggested Solution
 Add compatibility for Calculated Date/Time Field in Team Calendars
fields.summary: Allow referencing of calculated date/time fields from JIRA when adding JIRA Events using JIRA Issue Dates
Delete an event of type "JIRA Agile Sprint" without removing all the other events
Add a link on Child Sub Calendar menu for Reminder
give the user the option to accept or reject a calendar assigned to them
As the creator of a Scheduled Event I should be able to configure Reminders for only my Scheduled Event.
Calendar Legend width expand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49085].
  {panel}

When a user gets removed in the Active Directory, all events created by this user will be displayed as "Unknown User (<old_id>)" in Confluence. Also, users that have subscribed to a calendar containing events of deleted users, receive the following error when synchronizing the calendar in Microsoft Outlook:

!^outlook-error.png!

Once you have removed the events of the deleted users in Confluence, the error disappears.

*In our opinion, Team Calendars should remove events from deleted users automatically or at least provide administrators the ability to this manually as bulk operation.*
fields.summary: Ability to remove events of users that don't exist anymore
In team calendars when I share a calendar the message text and icon needs improvement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49083].
  {panel}

Not sure if this is a duplicate request (couldn't find any similar tickets) but a few of our users have requested the functionality of organising and ordering their event types when displayed in the key of the team calendar macro.

A number of their calendars include 10 or more event types and when they are using the team calendar macro to display a number of other calendars they would like to be able to align the ordering of the event types across all calendars.

I would imagine a simple drag and drop for reordering the event types in the calendar key would be a nice little feature.

Please make it so :)
fields.summary: Order Event Types in Team Calendar key
Allow User to Upload Their Own Custom Icons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49081].
  {panel}

h1. Problem
In default configuration, you can subscribe or watch a calendar, which affects that you receive email notifications every time anyone creates or updates calendar events in these calendars. 
This floods the inbox of our team members and important notifications are potentially ignored. 

h1. Idea
It would be helpful if you could globally (or personally) configure the calendar notifications to receive only email notifications if you are mentioned in or invited to an event.
fields.summary: Create an option to only receive calendar notifications if user is mentioned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49079].
  {panel}

Since Team Calendars 1.0, Calendars have lived outside spaces. What this has meant that they have a different permission and notification model to spaces. 

We've learnt over the last few years that for most calendars, they really belong to a space. 

We should consider changing Team Calendars so that they live in spaces. Some things to think about:

* How do we migrate existing calendars?
** You can link a calendar to a space today - we could use this
** What if the calendar has different permissions to space permissions?
* What is the experience for creating a new calendar? 
* Should Calendars should be part of space export / import

It could look something like this: 
http://cl.ly/image/3F3m2g0B0Z0x
fields.summary: Team Calendars should live in Spaces

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49078].
  {panel}

Hello!

We would like to have an option to "Description" showing in Calendar if calendar macro is used in narrow column. Also "What" part could be shortened more. Please see an attached image where column is narrow and all events create huge box and monthly calendar (which must be used, this is Intranet frontpage) cannot be fit in one screen.

In pop up screen everything is fine. Just added it to image to show what parts are shown in actual calendar grid (color coded).

Thanks.

BR,

Jarno
fields.summary: Option to disable Description viewing in Calendar when it's used in narrow space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49077].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The Team Calendar which are restricted in a space or page level are visible for user who do not have permission to the page and space.

h3. Step to Replicate
# Restrict the Space view permission to USERA
# USERA Create a page with a team Calender (calB) in it.

h3. Expected Result
User other than USERA  will not be able to see the calendar (calB)

h3. Observed Result
The user who does not have the permission in the space or page will be able to find the calendar in the calendar search and are able to view the calendar through  calendar link.
fields.summary: Team Calendar Does not respect the Space Permission and Page restriction
Filter Team Calendar search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49074].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Users would like to insert a calendar macro in Confluence which dynamically changes to the current user's personal calendar. If you attempt to insert the link ~/calendar/mycalendar.action, it will only display as a link to the calendar, but not display the calendar macro itself.

Since Confluence does not recognize this as a calendar URL, it's not possible to use with the Team Calendar Macro.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create an ability in the macro to link current calendar at the My Calendar link
fields.summary: Ability to insert My Calendar into Confluence page for any user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-49073].
  {panel}

I'd like to request the ability to integrate/embed my Outlook Calendar with Team Calendar.

The Scenario is as follows:
- Our company (~1600 employees) uses Outlook/Exchange Calendar for personal availability, meeting and vacation scheduling.
- Thus Team Calendar will always be on at least second position to fill with calendar information. So at your team/project you need to put your vacation information for example on two systems.
- So managing personal Calendar information in only one system (the personal one in outlook) would be nice. --> Team calendar should only aggregate calendar information.

To integrate Outlook I see following possibilities:
- It gets an adapter to fetch MS-Exchange Calendar Information (providing server and authentification information)
- there is a plugin/modus via export/import
- There is a Module/Plugin for Outlook to bind it into Outlook Client and set up write/read permissions to the Team Calendar... :)
- maybe other more ideas.
fields.summary: Outlook Integration
Ability to reorder the event in the calendar
Ability to display the component field on JIRA issue dates
As a Admin I want to be able to add company Holidays/Events globally
Limit number of events per day/week
Display a single users calendar
As an admin I would like to cretae "global calendars"
